main event: On July 29, 1956, approximately 400 miles west of Monterey, California, a bright, white, disc-shaped flying object was observed for a duration of 2 minutes. The object changed speed and color during the observation.
interesting points: The sighting was classified as a D Ground-Visual evaluation and photographs were taken.
The bright object was observed passing a flight faster and higher than normal aircraft, at an altitude of 21,000 ft.
The object's lights seemed round and appeared to go to a pointing star before fading from view in a dark night.
There were no fumes observed from the object, and it had a swift disappearance.
The communication form indicates a possible intrusion and unknown aircraft passes.
